Title: ★★★★ “THE LATE GREAT COMEDIANS BROUGHT TO VIVID LIFE” – NY STAGE REVIEW (SPONSORED)

Content:
★★★★ “THE LATE GREAT COMEDIANS BROUGHT TO VIVID LIFE” – NY STAGE REVIEW (SPONSORED)
Penguin Rep Theatre
presents
GENE & GILDA
By Cary Gitter
Directed by Joe Brancato
With Jordan Kai Burnett and Jonathan Randell Silver
Comic geniuses Gene Wilder (
Willy Wonka, Young Frankenstein
) and Gilda Radner (
Saturday Night Live
) had a love like no other. What started as a friendship on a movie set grew into an electric and enduring romance. In this heartfelt and hilarious new play, Wilder and Radner share their love and their laughter with us, even as they navigate some of life’s hardest challenges.
Use code SKINT to snag $26 tickets* (incl. $6 fee – reg. $66-$86)!
Valid for all performances
Performances: July 23 – Sept 7. Tue – Fri 7:00; Sat 2:00 & 7:00; Sun 2:00
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFO
59E59 Theaters – a quick block from SUBWAY 4/5/6 N/W/R at 59 St.
*Standard service fees apply to all phone/internet orders. Limit 4 tickets per order. All offers subject to availability. This offer may be revoked or modified at any time without notice. Not valid with any other offer.

Title: TUES-THURS, 8/12-14: FREE GUINNESS ICE CREAM, ¡ARRIBA! ON THE HIGH LINE, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 8/12-14: FREE GUINNESS ICE CREAM, ¡ARRIBA! ON THE HIGH LINE, AND MORE
tuesday
thru sat (7pm):
44th annual battery dance festival
: new york city’s longest-running free public dance festival returns to nelson a. rockefeller park with waterfront performances by diverse dance companies from new york and around the world.
>>
tues + thurs:
free guinness ice cream
: two chances to score a free sample of van leeuwen’s limited-edition guinness draught stout ice cream: the van leeuwen shop in williamsburg (tues 5-7pm, served alongside a tiny pour of guinness draught); a branded ice cream truck at astor place (thurs 12-8pm, ice cream only).
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
barbie
at the rooftop at pier 17 (lower manhattan)
>>
dune: part two
at cadman plaza park (brooklyn heights / downtown brooklyn)
>>
the hunger games: the ballad of songbirds and snakes
at bella abzug park (hell’s kitchen)
>>
the secret life of pets
and
rent
at domino park (williamsburg)
>>
wicked
at harsimus cemetery (jersey city)
>>
tues 6pm:
new york’s scoundrels, scalawags, and scrappers: the city in the last decade of the gilded age
: new york historian and mapmaker john tauranac (
the empire state building: the making of a landmark
) discusses his new book,
new york’s scoundrels, scalawags, and scrappers: the city in the last decade of the gilded age
, at the skyscraper museum (battery park). free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (season ends tonight):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: mireya ramos. free admission.
>>
sponsored
image by Jen Chou
The Chain Theatre is thrilled to announce the
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
. A cinematic celebration of bold voices and original storytelling, this year’s festival features
over 160 films
from around the globe—narratives, documentaries, shorts, web series, and animated works—plus panels, filmmaker events, and an awards ceremony.
•
Special Event: Industry Panel with Geoffrey Cantor
on Sunday, August 17 | 2PM
Join
Geoffrey Cantor
(
Daredevil, The Punisher
) for a candid discussion on career longevity and indie film survival. Tickets are Free. Reservations required.
Past guests have included
Oscar-winning writers, Emmy-nominated creators
, and industry legends like
Richard LaGravenese
and
Richard Price
. The 2025 festival continues this legacy of discovery and excellence. Chain Theatre’s past collaborators include
Eric Bogosian, Jesse Eisenberg
, and
John Patrick Shanley
sharing new work with Off-Broadway audiences.
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
AUGUST 7-17
The Chain Theatre
312 W 36 Street, 3rd & 4th Floor (Between 8th and 9th ave)
All screenings are $13 in advance and $15 at the door
MORE INFO AND TICKETS
wednesday
cultural fests / street fairs / food events
(free admission):
► weds thru sun (weds-fri 5-11pm, sat + sun 2-11pm):
holy rosary church’s annual la festa italiana
: 344 6 street in jersey city.
>>
► thurs thru 8/24:
51st feast of santa rosalia
: 18th avenue from 68th to 75th street in bensonhurst, brooklyn.
>>
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
sponsored
:
bloodsport
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
downton abbey
at pier a park (hoboken)
>>
elemental
at pier i at riverside park south (uws)
>>
hook
at lawn area mckinley park (dyker heights)
>>
inside out 2
at carl schurz park (yorkville)
>>
loving vincent
at coffey park (red hook)
>>
sonic the hedgehog 3
at prospect park (brooklyn)
>>
there was, there was not
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
transformers one
at bellevue south park (kips bay)
>>
weds 6pm (season ends tonight):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: singer–songwriter grace vanderwaal with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (monthly):
fantastic fiction at kgb
: this monthly speculative-fiction reading series, hosted by editor ellen datlow and writer matthew kressel at kgb bar (east village), welcomes writers cassandra khaw (
the library at hellebore
) and debra k. every (
deena undone
) for a night of readings and discussion. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm:
doctors without boundaries
: real-life er doctor aaron bola hosts a comedy show where standups with a tendency towards t.m.i. tell stories about their weirdest diagnoses, and the docs give a detailed breakdown of the history of each condition and what people diagnosed with it should know. audience members can even ask their own embarrassing medical questions via a ‘no co-pay’ question box. featuring ben miller, kenny park yi, sheria mattis, sureni weerasekera, and isa medina. caveat (les), $16.70 with promo code ‘resident’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
weds 7pm (season ends tonight):
jazz at pier 84
: jazz up your evening with the jazz foundation of america’s free outdoor concerts at hudson river park’s pier 84 (hell’s kitchen). the season concludes tonight with trombonist clifton anderson.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
we have fun: a stand-up show
: hosts zach sims and dan wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to young ethel’s (south slope), with stand-up by liz miele (hulu), dave ross (comedy central), andrew durso (cracked), and abe gatling. free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring devon walker (
snl
), graham kay (
colbert
), lizzy cassidy (don’t tell comedy), april boddie (adult swim), and henry sir (comedy central). hosted by josh johnson, brittany cardwell, and lucas connolly. byob. bonus: rsvp enters you in a raffle for $200 towards a tattoo from stefano’s tattoo studio. free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
my kinda night! a queer variety show
: billie bullock and sarah creamin’ onion host an evening filled with drag, cabaret, comedy, and more at medusa bar brooklyn (east williamsburg). free admission (bring $ to tip the performers).
>>
thursday
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
13 going on 30
at union square park
>>
captain america: brave new world
at the unisphere in flushing meadows corona park (queens)
>>
clueless
at fort greene park (brooklyn)
>>
coco
at 145th st and the hudson in riverside park (west harlem)
>>
despicable me 4
at maria hernandez park (bushwick)
>>
hamilton
sing-along
at old stone house + washington park (park slope)
>>
the wild robot
at sgt. anthony park (jersey city)
>>
trainwreck
at pier 1 harbor view lawn (brooklyn bridge park)
>>
wicked
at dry dock playground (alphabet city)
>>
shrek
at fosun plaza at 28 liberty street (lower manhattan)
>>
thurs 6-9pm:
¡arriba! dance party on the high line
: a section of the high line turns into an open-air dance floor for the elevated park’s annual salsa party series. tonight: salsa lessons followed by dj sets by mickey pérez and a live performance by cheo y los consentidos de la casa. on the high line between 15th + 16th streets (enter at 14th street). free admission (note: advance registration is encouraged, and walk-ups are welcome if the event isn’t at capacity).
>>
thurs 7pm (+ 8/28):
the queens jazz trail concert series
: inspired by the queens jazz trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, the annual the queens jazz trail concert series presents seven free jazz concerts in queens parks. tonight: high + mighty brass band at forest park bandshell in woodhaven.
>>
thurs 8pm (monthly):
savage! comedy show
: savage comedy returns to logan’s run in park slope. hosted by lizzie martinez, melissa rocha, nonye brown-west, and chloé cunha, tonight’s show includes standup by jonathan van halem, nell kessler, royce wynn, molly brenner, and brian longwell. bonus: rsvp for a chance to win a free drink. free admission.
>>
thurs 8:45pm (monthly):
comedy ugly: a comedy strip show
: comedians reveal more than just punchlines at comedy ugly, a standup show where performers remove an article of clothing between jokes. featuring: brittany brave, chase hoffman, stephen bolles, natalie lim, and marito lopez. hosted by alysia hush, marisa riley, and kim dinaro. easy lover (east williamsburg), $5.
>>
thurs 9:30pm:
facebook marketplace live!
: inspired by facebook marketplace, craigslist, and buy nothing groups, this game show pits comedians in a series of marketplace-themed games to win the title of ‘king of sh*t.’ hosted by amanda melhuish (reductress) and virginia dickens (the onion). caveat (les), $16.70 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $22-23).
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: summer restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: FRI-MON, 8/8-11: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 8/8-11: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
►
sponsored
: fri 6:30-10pm:
intrepid summer beer wine and spirits fest
: intrepid museum (hell’s kitchen). save 40% on advance tickets with promo code ‘theskint’
>>
► fri-sun:
annual east harlem giglio festival
: pleasant avenue between 114th + 116th streets (east harlem).
>>
► sat 10am-8pm:
brooklyn bites by blundstone: rooftop food festival
: brooklyn grange at sunset park (brooklyn).
>>
► sat 12-7pm:
spike’s joint pop-up poster + book stoop sale
: at filmmaker spike lee’s 40 acres and a mule hq (fort greene). bonus: lee be in attendance for signings.
>>
► sat 12-7pm:
black vegfest
: lincoln terrace park (crown heights).
>>
► sat 2-8pm:
yoga block party
: graham ave between scholes and meserole (east williamsburg).
>>
► sat 2-8pm:
k-pop foodie fest
: magnolia landing (jersey city).
>>
► sat + sun (9am-5pm):
35th hong kong dragon boat festival
at flushing meadows corona park (queens).
>>
► sun 10am-5pm:
handmade in the boroughs bazaar at grand bazaar nyc
: indoors and outdoors at 100 w 77th st at columbus ave (uws).
>>
► sun 11pm:
43rd annual dominican day parade
: sixth avenue from w 39th to w 54th streets.
>>
► sun 12-7pm:
a great day in harlem
(part of harlem week): general grant national memorial (morningside heights).
>>
► sun 12-9pm (monthly thru 9/6):
korea fest
: steinway street between 31st ave + broadway in astoria (queens).
>>
► sun 1pm:
frozen treats takedown
: threes brewing (gowanus). $30.
>>
► sun 2pm:
jo firestone presents the first annual pie tasting festival
: littlefield (gowanus), $15.
>>
► sun 4:30-8:30pm:
chinatown block party
: mosco street (chinatown, manhattan).
>>
► sun 5-8:30pm:
ninth annual indian independence day celebration
: exchange place plaza in jersey city.
>>
► sun thru 8/17:
28th annual nyc black pride
: various locations and prices.
>>
► mon thru 8/24:
grand street summer restaurant week
: east williamsburg.
>>
sponsored
image by Jen Chou
friday
thru 9/14 (previews 8/7-20):
free shakespeare in the park:
twelfth night
: the public theater’s free shakespeare in the park returns to central park’s revitalized delacorte theater with a star-studded production of
twelfth night
directed by saheem ali and starring lupita nyong’o, junior nyong’o, sandra oh, khris davis, peter dinklage, jesse tyler ferguson, daphne rubin-vega, moses sumney, john ellison conlee, and b. five ways to get free tickets: in-person at the theater in the park, at an in-person lottery at the public theater in noho, in-person at select distribution points in the five boroughs on specific dates, in-person standby line at the theater in the park, and via a digital lottery on the todaytix app.
>>
thru 8/31:
alan turing + the queen of the night
: the life story of mathematician and computer scientist alan turing merges with the enchanting world of mozart’s
the magic flute
in a new queer fantasy musical by michael vegas mussman and payton millet. the players theatre (greenwich village), tickets for $20+ with promo code ‘fantasy1912’ (reg. $34+).
>>
sponsored
: thru 8/17:
chain nyc film festival
: the chain theatre is thrilled to announce the 2025 chain nyc film festival. a cinematic celebration of bold voices and original storytelling, this year’s festival features over 160 films from around the globe—narratives, documentaries, shorts, web series, and animated works—plus panels, filmmaker events, and an awards ceremony. chain theatre (garment district / hell’s kitchen), $13+.
>>
thru 8/14:
bad survivor
with alex dvorak
: join writer/director alex dvorak and producer/director katie north at a screening of their short (11 min) indie dark comedy
bad survivor
. inspired by true events, the film follows a sarcastic young cancer patient who struggles to adjust to life at home during her first day in remission. note: dvorak and north will be in-person at all screenings. quad cinema (greenwich village), $10.
>>
thru sat (season ends saturday):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: silent discos with dj lucha (thurs 9pm) and hourglass (fri 10pm), a social dance with cait jones (fri 6:30pm), brooklyn rider string quartet 20th anniversary performances (thru sat), ruidosa fest (sat 4pm), and more.
>>
sponsored
: thru sun:
get insider access to the city’s best secrets this weekend with new york adventure club!
explore grand central terminal and the subterranean lirr station; unlock the private gilded age mausoleums at woodlawn cemetery; go on a walking tour of greenwich village and visit the iconic hangouts of beat generation legends; and much more this weekend and beyond with new york adventure club!
>>
thru sun (various times):
summerstage
: summerstage presents a series of free outdoor shows this weekend: tony vega, la excelencia, and ariacne trujillo at coney island amphitheater (fri 7-10pm); rakim, positive k, sweet tee, jeski love, nice + smooth, dj chubby, and host ralph mcdaniels of video music box at stapleton waterfront park in staten island (sat 6-9pm); a celia cruz celebration with issac delgado, alain perez, aymee nuviola, brenda navarrete, and melvis santa in central park (sat 7-10pm); la sonora ponceña, judy torres, linda epo, dj millo, and hosted vinnie medugno at stapleton waterfront park in staten island (sun 5-9pm); the originals featuring rich medina, stretch armstrong, and tony touch at central park (sun 5-10pm).
>>
fri + sat (6pm doors):
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running, free, outdoor performing arts festival returns to prospect park’s lena horne bandshell for two months. this weekend: adrian quesada and trish toledo (fri); lyricist lounge presents: raekwon the chef
only built 4 cuban linx
30th anniversary show (sat).
>>
sponsored
: fri + sat (7:30pm doors):
demolition man
: fan parody event
: after sold out performances of
titanic, tmnt
and
star wars
, the usual rejects are back at the chain theatre with ‘send a maniac to catch a maniac: demolition man,’ a staged parody fan event filled with trivia, raffe prizes, audience participation, and more. bonus: ticket includes a complimentary drink. save $5 with promo code ‘skint’
>>
fri various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
encanto
at john jay park (ues)
>>
sing sing
at transmitter park (greenpoint)
>>
sonic the hedgehog 3
at triangle park (jersey city)
>>
the warriors
at gil scott-heron amphitheater in st. mary’s park (bronx)
>>
fri 4-10pm (fridays thru 8/22):
warm up 2025
: kick off your summer weekends at moma ps1’s warm up, the popular outdoor music series spotlighting underground and emerging electronic talent from around the world. dance in ps1’s open-air courtyard, featuring yto barrada’s installation
le grand soir
, and explore the museum’s exhibitions until late. tonight: marie davidson, loka, concrete husband, and fred moten with brandon lopez. moma ps1 (lic) $25+ general, $20+ students.
>>
fri 6-9pm:
sounds at sunset
: brooklyn bridge park’s intimate outdoor music series returns for four nights this season. tonight: igmar thomas’ revive big band. free admission.
>>
fri 6-10pm:
bpl’s plaza performance series
: dj max glazer takes over brooklyn public library’s plaza (prospect heights). free admission
>>
fri 7pm (monthly):
vocabaret: ‘changes’ edition
: wordplay takes center stage at vocabaret, a monthly variety show for language lovers. five of nyc’s wittiest wordsmiths serve up slideshows, games, and other entertainment—all inspired by a new theme each month. hosted by sam corbin, tim donnelly, jerzy gwiazdowski, ally spier, and nikolai vanyo. caveat (les), $18.76 with promo code ‘caveatorb’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
fri 7pm:
poets house’s summer nights
: poetry meets music outdoors at the season finale of poets house’s summer nights. hosted by brad walrond in robert f. wagner park (battery park city), tonight’s event features poets danez smith and m.s. redcherries with indie band speedy ortiz. free admission.
>>
fri 7pm:
bryant park picnic performances
: bryant park’s annual summer performance series is back with 25 evenings of free live music, theater, and dance in the heart of midtown. bring your own picnic or purchase food and drinks from on-site vendors. blankets and bistro chairs are provided for use. next up: carnegie hall’s citywide series presents singer-songwriter dez duron (
maybe happy ending, the voice
).
>>
fri 7:15pm:
angelheaded hipster: the songs of marc bolan + t. rex
with ethan silverman and john cameron mitchell
: roxy cinema (tribeca) hosts a screening of ethan silverman’s new documentary
angelheaded hipster: the songs of marc bolan + t. rex
, followed by a discussion with silverman and john cameron mitchell (
hedwig and the angry inch
). $18
>>
fri 7:30pm:
the existentialists comedy show
: adrienne hunter and jer wenick bring together a panel of ‘radical leftists’ and a lineup of comics to perform their most controversial material to ask the age-old question: ‘can anyone even say anything anymore?’ featuring sabrina wu, sophia wilson pelton, michael abber, esther fallick, bridget foley, and amanda gordon. rabbit hole bk (bushwick), $15 adv, $18 door.
>>
fri 8pm (monthly):
boyz in the woods comedy
: kenice mobley, tawanda gona, josh stokes, and kofi thomas host this standup-meets-trivia show, where audience members can win free drinks by answering pop culture and hip-hop trivia questions between sets. featuring vanessa jackson (
snl
), onika mclean (hbo), murahd shawki (@murahdshawki), and angel contreras. friends and lovers (crown heights), $12 adv, $15 door.
>>
fri 8:30pm:
bitches brew comedy show
: this women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of halyards (gowanus). tonight’s performers include jenny zigrino (comedy central), anjelica scannura (don’t tell comedy), camille roberts, ryan ergo, geneva rust-orta, and megan mcmurty. free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show).
>>
fri 9pm:
drop up video
: a panel of comedians riff on the music videos that we love to hate. featuring max higgins, robbie goodwin, annie lockwood, kevin o’brien, trey gaylon, and justin thompson. pine box rock shop (bushwick), $5.
>>
saturday
sat thru 8/23:
time:spans contemporary music festival
: time:spans, an annual festival of 21st-century music, returns to the dimenna center for classical music (midtown west) for two weeks. this year’s performers include ensemble nikel, jack quartet, international contemporary ensemble, no hay banda, sixtrum percussion, talea ensemble, yarn/wire, and many others. $20 general, $10 students/seniors.
>>
sat + sun (8am-6pm):
12th annual
taiwan: a world of orchids
: immerse yourself in a display of hundreds of orchids, talk with orchid experts, make orchid crafts, participate in a tea ceremony, shop vendors, and more at queens botanical garden’s
taiwan: a world of orchids
weekend. included with regular admission ($6 general, $4 seniors/students).
>>
sat + sun (1pm-8pm):
nomad jazz festival
: bring a blanket and settle in for the sounds of world-class jazz in madison square park. the inaugural nomad jazz festival, curated by the jazz gallery’s rio sakairi, spans two full days and features live performances by lizz wright, ravi coltrane, brandee younger, roy hargrove big band, michael mayo, dabin ryu trio, arta jēkabsone, caracas trio, and melissa almaguer. free admission.
>>
sat + sun (1:30-6pm):
show brain festival
: show brain’s third annual festival takes over tompkins square park (east village) with two days of music, featuring performances by daddy long legs, the thing, dion lunadon, dead tooth, 95 bulls, the mystery lights, natvie sun, fine mess, and more. all ages. free admission (donations welcome).
>>
sat various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
elemental
at field 62 in randall’s island park
>>
labyrinth
at fosun plaza at 28 liberty street (lower manhattan)
>>
sonic the hedgehog 3
at p.s. 155 playground (east harlem)
>>
the great dictator
at valentino pier (red hook)
>>
the warriors
at coney island beach + boardwalk at west 12th street
>>
sat 7am-3pm (saturdays thru 8/23):
nyc summer streets festival
:the annual summer streets festival turns nyc into a car-free playground, with over 400 blocks open for walking, running, biking, and exploring across five saturdays. enjoy free performances, fitness classes, kids’ activities, and more. today: manhattan (from the brooklyn bridge to broadway and dykman street).
>>
sat 3:30-7pm:
great jazz on the great hill
: jazzmobile’s annual outdoor concert returns to central park’s great hill with performances by lezlie harrison, josh evans, wallace roney, jr., and the george gee swing orchestra. enter the park at 106th street + central park west. free admission.
>>
sat 7pm (+ 8/12-16):
44th annual battery dance festival
: new york city’s longest-running free public dance festival returns to battery park city’s robert f. wagner park (8/9) and nelson a. rockefeller park (8/12-16) with six evenings of waterfront performances by diverse dance companies from new york and around the world.
>>
sat 7pm doors:
rooftop films presents: ‘url in irl: tales from the timeline’
: the popular rooftop films series, one of the word’s longest-running and largest outdoor showcases for indie film, returns for its 29th season. tonight: ‘url in irl: tales from the timeline,’ a program of short films that dive into how the virtual shapes our irl identities, connections, delusions, and discoveries. q+a with the filmmakers and an afterparty will follow. industry city courtyard 5/6 (brooklyn), $20.
>>
sat 8:30pm:
improvised road trip movie
: buckle up! improv group help me i’m drowning performs an hour-long improvised road trip movie based on audience suggestions. brooklyn comedy collective pig pen (williamsburg), $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
sat 9:30pm:
story-oke: sing and tell
: part karaoke, part confessional. story-oke invites performers and audience members alike to share a true story about their connection to a song – or the song itself – and then sing the hell out of it. tonight’s premiere features stories about neil diamond and thai culture,
wicked
inspirations, the story of
chess
the musical, and more. plus, whatever you, the audience, brings to the stage. hosted by shyaporn theerakulstit. caveat (les), $13.61 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $18.76-20).
>>
sponsored
: sat 10:30pm:
party like it’s 1999: don’t go chasing waterfalls editions
: brooklyn’s best 90s and 00s dance party returns with a night of the biggest hits that ruled the 1990s and 2000’s. tonight’s edition celebrates the 30th anniversary of tlc’s ‘waterfalls’ with double shots of t-boz, chilli and left eye all night long, plus all of your favorite pop, r+b, rock, hip-hop, and dance tunes spun by dj steve reynolds. tickets are only $5 (plus $2.42 eventbrite fee).
>>
sponsored
image by Jen Chou
sunday
sun thru 9/24:
cyberpunk: envisioning possible futures through cinema
: the academy museum of motion pictures and the paris theater team up for a screening series highlighting a dozen cyberpunk-themed films:
blade runner: the final cut, escape from new york, existenz, ghost in the shell, neptune frost, robocop, strange days, testsuo: the iron man, the matrix, the terminator, videodrome
(director’s cut), and
world on a wire
. the paris theater (midtown), $17 general, $15 seniors.
>>
sun 12-6pm: (monthly):
pioneer works second sundays
: pioneer works’ free monthly open house celebrates creativity across art, music, science, and community. with programming spread across three floors the garden, this month’s edition features open studios with current artists-in-residence, live music, hands-on workshops, solar gazing, and more—culminating in the
legendary looks
mini-ball, a runway competition inspired by felix rodriguez’s exhibition
legendary looks: my ballroom story
. pioneer works (red hook), free admission (donations welcome).
>>
sun 2-6pm (sundays thru 8/24):
union pool’s 13th annual summer thunder concert series
: williamsburg’s union pool hosts free afternoon concerts every sunday thru summer. today: gunn – truscinski duo, real young, lazy horse, and dj brian turner. note: according to union pool’s instagram, admission is first come first served and rsvp is not required for entry.
>>
sun 6pm (monthly):
public victories
: from running the dishwasher to running a marathon, four performers—and one audience member—share true stories of personal triumphs, big or small, at the public victories storytelling show. featuring allie lawrence, joanna briley, jayden heather malsky, and whitney chanel. hosted by mary-alice mcnab. young ethel’s (south slope), free admission (donations welcome).
>>
sun 7:30pm doors:
outdoor movie
:
annihilation
on the rooftop at noosphere arts (greenpoint). $5+ suggested donation.
>>
monday
mon various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
inside out 2
at astoria park great lawn (astoria)
>>
the godfather
at bryant park (midtown)
>>
veneno: primera caída – el relámpago de jack
at the hudson (inwood)
>>
mon 3:45pm, 7pm, 10:15pm (monthly):
35mm series at angelika
: experience a series of ‘classic’ films in their original 35mm format at village east by angelika (east village). tonight: martin scorsese’s
goodfellas
(1990), starring ray liotta, robert de niro, joe pesci, and lorraine bracco. $21.
>>
mon 6:30pm (season ends today):
broadway by the boardwalk
: enjoy show tunes with a view at broadway by the boardwalk, an annual summer concert series featuring broadway stars performing at clinton cove in hudson river park. this outdoor event invites guests to bring blankets, stretch out on the grass, and take in an evening of music right by the water. the season concludes tonight with anthony rapp and adam pascal(
rent
). free admission.
>>
mon 7pm:
nyc magic ensemble
: expect the unexpected as the nyc magic ensemble presents a night of magicians and mentalists at caveat (les), featuring performers carl mercurio (broadway magic hour), matt szat (
kimmel
), and mike kurylo (gift of magic). $20 general, 2 for $30.
>>
mon 8pm (monthly):
franklin park reading series
: the crown heights bar and beer garden’s reading series presents an evening with writers kashana cauley (
the payback
), katie yee (
maggie; or, a man and a woman walk into a bar
), emily hunt kivel (
dwelling
), samuel ashworth (
the death and life of august sweeney
), duncan b. barlow (
awry
), and quincy scott jones (
how to kill yourself instead of your children
). books will be available for purchase from indie bookseller unnameable books. free admission.

Title: PARTY LIKE IT’S 1999: DON’T GO CHASING WATERFALLS EDITION – AUG 9 (SPONSORED)

Content:
PARTY LIKE IT’S 1999: DON’T GO CHASING WATERFALLS EDITION – AUG 9 (SPONSORED)
The number-one song of the land in the summer of 1995 was a meaningful gem from a trio called TLC.
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
will mark that 30th anniversary by giving you double shots of T-Boz, Chilli and Left Eye all night long. Plus DJ Steve will also serve up our usual mix of the best rock, pop, R&B, hip-hop and dance tunes from the 1990s and 2000s!
Unhitch that overall strap, lace up your Docs, tie that flannel around your waist, put on some frosted lip gloss and set your VCR to record Dawson’s Creek and Gilmore Girls — Party Like it’s 1999 is Brooklyn’s best 1990s and 2000s dance party where you’ll shake it to the best pop, rock, hip hop and R&B jams all night long!
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
Saturday, August 9 10:30pm – 3:30 am
Littlefield
635 Sackett Street
Brooklyn, NY 11217
• R to Union Street, then
one block to Sackett Street
• 2, 3, 4, 5, B, D, N, Q to
Atlantic Avenue or Pacific Street. 9 blocks south to Sackett Street
GET TICKETS

Title: ANNOUNCING THEATRE FOR A NEW AUDIENCE’S 25/26 SEASON: SAVE ON SUBSCRIPTIONS NOW (SPONSORED)

Content:
ANNOUNCING THEATRE FOR A NEW AUDIENCE’S 25/26 SEASON: SAVE ON SUBSCRIPTIONS NOW (SPONSORED)
Theatre for a New Audience is proud to celebrate its 46th season:
David Eldridge
’s new version of
Henrik Ibsen
’s
The Wild Duck
, directed by
Simon Godwin
; William
Shakespeare
’s
The Tragedy of Coriolanus
, directed by
Ash K. Tata
; and Teatro La Plaza’s
Hamlet
, inspired by Shakespeare’s play, performed in Spanish with projected English translation, written and directed by
Chela De Ferrari
.
If you subscribe to our 25/26 season by
August 11
, you can take advantage of exclusive early-bird pricing. You’ll receive tickets for all three shows at just $55 each (regularly $95), a
savings of 42%
off the full ticket price, while enjoying exclusive benefits like priority booking, flexible ticket exchanges, discounted guest tickets
(Early Bird Special: $40 per ticket (regularly $60 per ticket))
, and more. Two-play and four-ticket Flex Pass packages are also available.
We invite you to join us at our home, Polonsky Shakespeare Center in Brooklyn, for our extraordinary upcoming season.
GET TICKETS AT
TFANA.ORG
Polonsky Shakespeare Center: 262 Ashland Place, Brooklyn, NY 11217
Contact the Box Office at
646-553-3880
or
tickets@TFANA.org
. Summer Box Office hours are Monday–Thursday, 1–6pm, Friday, 12PM-3PM; Saturday and Sunday closed.
A $10 convenience fee is added to all season subscription packages. This fee covers all transactions associated with the subscription during the 2025-2026 season.
Face masks are encouraged, but not required
.
Click here
to learn more about our ticket and venue policies.
Design by Paul Davis Studio / Paige Restaino
Deloitte is the 2025-2026 Season Sponsor.
Principal support for Theatre for a New Audience’s season and programs is provided by Alan Beller and Stephanie Neville, The Jerome and Marlène Brody Foundation, Robert E. Buckholz and Lizanne Fontaine, Constance Christensen, The Hearst Foundations, the Howard Gilman Foundation, the Jerome L. Greene Foundation Fund at the New York Community Trust, The Polonsky Foundation, The SHS Foundation, The Shubert Foundation, and The Thompson Family Foundation.
Theatre for a New Audience’s season and programs are also made possible, in part, with public funds from the National Endowment for the Humanities; Shakespeare in American Communities, a program of the National Endowment for the Arts in partnership with Arts Midwest; the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature; and the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council.

Title: TUES-THURS, 8/5-7: SHAKESPEARE IN THE PARK, Z100 SUMMER BASH, WRITTEN IN BROOKLYN, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 8/5-7: SHAKESPEARE IN THE PARK, Z100 SUMMER BASH, WRITTEN IN BROOKLYN, AND MORE
tuesday
thru 8/23:
hip to hip theatre company
: hip to hip theatre company’s annual season brings
the tempest
and
hamlet
at eight parks in queens, long island, and jersey city. free admission.
>>
thru sat (season ends saturday):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: social dances with judy santos (weds 6:30pm) and cait jones (fri 6:30pm), silent discos with dj lucha (thurs 9pm) and hourglass (fri 10pm), kim changwan band and touched (weds 7:30pm), brooklyn rider string quartet 20th anniversary performances (thurs-sat), a double dutch fusion freestyle + open jump with the national double dutch league (thurs 5pm), ruidosa fest (sat 4pm), and more.
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
love + basketball
at bella abzug park (hell’s kitchen)
>>
the hundred foot journey
on the rooftop at pier 17 (lower manhattan)
>>
the mitchells vs the machines
at colonel david marcus playground (midwood)
>>
twisters
at hunter’s point south park (lic)
>>
tues 7pm:
score: ‘interpreting epic cinema through comedy and dance’
: a swarm of cinephile stand-ups discuss classic cinema and popcorn pleasers as emmy harrington (
the marvelous mrs. maisel
) brings each film’s score to life through dance. tonight’s edition targets
the silence of the lambs, forrest gump, the matrix
, and
a league of their own
. hosted by jimmy schatz. eris mainstage (williamsburg), $16.88+.
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: malika zarra. free admission.
>>
tues 7:15pm + 8pm:
the chess fight
: brooklyn action theater makes its debut with
the chess fight
, a reimagining of a chess match from the perspective of the pieces themselves. staged outdoors at brooklyn bridge park’s harbor view lawn, the ‘knight’ out features dramatic and comedic moments, plus stage combat with 10 different weapons. free admission (tips are encouraged).
>>
tues 7:30pm (season ends tonight):
naumburg orchestral concerts: 2025 season
: the naumburg orchestral concerts series returns for its 120th season at historic naumburg bandshell in central park. tonight: east coast chamber orchestra (ecco), a self-conducted chamber orchestra, performs works by j.s. bach, george gershwin, david ludwig, jennifer higdon, and john adams. hosted by wqxr’s terrance mcknight. all concerts will be broadcast live. free admission.
>>
sponsored
The
Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
comes to the historic Intrepid Museum on
Friday, August 8
, pouring more than 100 styles of beer, wine, and sprits from producers near and far! It’s a perfect chance to hang with friends and chat with brewers, sommeliers, and master distillers about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours.
Guests can enjoy unlimited samples all night, plus live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Chavas Empanadas, Mozzarepas, and Taste of Poland.
Special offer for the skint readers
:
Save 40% on advance tickets with promo code THESKINT
GET TICKETS NOW!
Intrepid Summer Beer Wine and Spirits Fest
Friday, August 8
6:30-10pm
The Intrepid Museum
Pier 86, W 46th St, New York, NY 10036
21+ Only
wednesday
weds thru sun:
14th annual greenpoint film festival
: the greenpoint film festival returns with five days of narrative and documentary shorts and features, animated shorts, and more. broadway stages, $15.
>>
weds + thurs 5pm doors (thru 8/17):
rise up nyc
: the rise up nyc summer concert series returns with 10 free outdoor concerts across the five boroughs. this week’s bronx edition features luis vargas, josé alberto, el blachy, and george lamond (weds) and a boogie, epmd, and rakim (thurs) at orchard beach.
>>
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
a minecraft movie
at sunset park (brooklyn)
>>
butch cassidy + the sundance kid
at pier i at riverside park south (uws)
>>
ferris bueller’s day off
at pier a park (hoboken)
>>
laura
at elizabeth street garden (nolita)
>>
migration
at carl schurz park (yorkville)
>>
ruby gillman, teenage kraken
at peter’s field (gramercy)
>>
shahid
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
the smurfs
at prospect park (brooklyn)
>>
sponsored
:
whatever happened to baby jane?
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
weds 5-8pm:
sva artist residency programs open studios: session ii
: explore the creative spaces of 40 residency participants from school of visual arts’s painting, mixed media, illustration and visual storytelling programs. sva flatiron gallery, free admission.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: singer–songwriter mxmtoon with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm:
next slide please: a powerpoint comedy show
: from data-driven rankings of the best manhattan street corners for first-date make-outs to passionate defenses of the 2003 jessica alba vehicle
honey
, expect anything when a lineup of comedians deliver side-splitting powerpoint presentations on whatever topic they choose. hosted by reed kavner. caveat (les), $18.76 with promo code ‘projector’ (reg. $24+).
>>
weds 7pm:
bpl’s plaza concert series
: 20-piece swingtime big band takes over brooklyn public library’s plaza (prospect heights) with the sounds of count basie, glenn miller, duke ellington, and many others. free admission
>>
weds 7pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
jazz at pier 84
: jazz up your evening with the jazz foundation of america’s free outdoor concerts at hudson river park’s pier 84 (hell’s kitchen). the season continues tonight with ginetta’s vendetta.
>>
weds 8pm:
written in brooklyn storytelling series presents: ‘take me baby or leave me’ edition
: join host carly ann filbin at farm.one, a hydroponic farm and brewery in prospect heights, for an evening of true stories about begging to be seen + longing for love, hard goodbyes + new hellos, and more. $17.85 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $28.52).
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring shalewa sharpe (comedy central), onika mclean (hbo), ali oneil (
worthless clowns
), andrew casertano, and ryan ergo. hosted by josh johnson, brittany cardwell, and lucas connolly. byob. bonus: rsvp enters you in a raffle for $200 towards a tattoo from stefano’s tattoo studio. free admission.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 9/14 (previews 8/7-20):
free shakespeare in the park:
twelfth night
: the public theater’s free shakespeare in the park returns to central park’s revitalized delacorte theater with a star-studded production of
twelfth night
directed by saheem ali and starring lupita nyong’o, junior nyong’o, sandra oh, khris davis, peter dinklage, jesse tyler ferguson, daphne rubin-vega, moses sumney, john ellison conlee, and b. five ways to get free tickets: in-person at the theater in the park, at an in-person lottery at the public theater in noho, in-person at select distribution points in the five boroughs on specific dates, in-person standby line at the theater in the park, and via a digital lottery on the todaytix app.
>>
sponsored
: thurs thru 8/17:
chain nyc film festival
: the chain theatre is thrilled to announce the 2025 chain nyc film festival. a cinematic celebration of bold voices and original storytelling, this year’s festival features over 160 films from around the globe—narratives, documentaries, shorts, web series, and animated works—plus panels, filmmaker events, and an awards ceremony. chain theatre (garment district / hell’s kitchen), $13+.
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
soul
at the softball fields in morningside park
>>
the spongebob squarepants movie
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
the sun is also a star
at 145th st and the hudson in riverside park (west harlem)
>>
the taking of pelham one two three
at union square park
>>
the wild robot
at wright brothers playground (washington heights)
>>
the wild robot
at thomas mcgovern park (jersey city)
>>
the wizard of oz
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor viewn lawn
>>
thurs 5pm doors:
z100 summer bash ’25
: iheartradio’s z100 summer bash returns to hudson yards with an outdoor concert featuring live performances by lewis capaldi, julia michaels, dom innarella, magnus ferrell, and deleasa. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm doors:
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running, free, outdoor performing arts festival returns to prospect park’s lena horne bandshell for two months. tonight: yup’ik choreographer emily johnson presents a performance of movement, sound, and story — set on 4,000 square feet of hand-stitched quilts by ojibwe artist maggie thompson.
>>
thurs 7pm:
econlol: an economics-themed comedy show
: bringing together comedians and sometimes real-life economists, luke strathmann’s economics-themed comedy show doesn’t promise to teach you anything about the economy, but it will give you a chance to laugh at it. featuring liz glazer (
fallon
), shafi hossain (peacock), taylor kay phillips (
last week tonight
), ikechukwu ufomadu (
ziwe
), and zach zimmerman (
after midnight
). caveat (les), $15.67 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
thurs 7pm:
john and scott: two person improv
: former
30 rock
cast members scott adsit and john lutz pair up for an improv show at ucb theatre (east village). $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
thurs 7pm (+ 8/14, 8/28):
the queens jazz trail concert series
: inspired by the queens jazz trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, the annual the queens jazz trail concert series presents seven free jazz concerts in queens parks. tonight: kim clarke + friends at travers park in jackson heights.
>>
thurs 7pm:
bilal: in concert
: grammy award-winning singer and songwriter bilal plays a free outdoor concert at downtown’s waterfront robert f. wagner park.
>>
thurs 7pm doors:
summerstage: ballet hispánico
: nyc-based latinx dance company ballet hispánico returns to central park’s rumsey playfield for tonight’s summerstage presentation. free admission.
>>
thurs 7:30pm:
authors across romance
: in honor of bookstore romance day (august 9), greenlight bookstore hosts authors kristina forest (
the greene sisters
series), adriana herrera (
las léonas
series), and marie rutkoski (
the winner’s trilogy
) for a panel discussion on romance—from ya to adult, romantasy to literary fiction, contemporary romance, and more. a wine reception will follow. greenlight bookstore (fort greene), free admission.
>>
thurs 7:30pm:
the parlor reading series
: the parlor, an interdisciplinary, community-based reading series, hosts its summer installment at brooklyn artery (flatbush/ditmas park). books and drinks will be available for purchase. free (suggested donation $15).
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: summer restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: DEMOLITION MAN: FAN PARODY EVENT! (SPONSORED)

Content:
DEMOLITION MAN: FAN PARODY EVENT! (SPONSORED)
image by Jen Chou
After SOLD OUT performances of
TITANIC, TMNT
and
STAR WARS
, the Usual Rejects are back and ready to bring you
SEND A MANIAC TO CATCH A MANIAC: DEMOLITION MAN
! A Staged Parody Fan event for the ages.
Trivia! Raffle Prizes! Audience Participation! Sign up for our silent auction for a chance to play God and deal out beers to the cast! Thaw our from your cryo-fluid, grab some Taco Bell and join us for a tale of mayhem between Spartan and Phoenix. With names like that you know there is only one way this can end: violence and explosions!!! But watch your mouth! Remember there is no-swearing! It’s the year 2032 after all. Do you even know how the three-seashells work? Come find out before it’s too late.
Starring: David Rey, Lenny Thomas, Caroline Orlando, Christina Elise Perry, Laura Clare Browne, and Kirk Gostkowski
One complimentary drink with each ticket!
Save $5 on advance tickets with promo code “SKINT”
HERE
SEND A MANIAC TO CATCH A MANIAC: DEMOLITION MAN
August 8 + 9 (doors open at 7:30pm)
The Chain Theatre
312 W 36 Street, 4th Floor (Between 8th and 9th ave)
Please check your dates and times before booking your ticket. There are no refunds or ticket exchanges unless the event is cancelled.
ALL AUDIENCE MUST BE 21 YEARS AND OLDER
USUAL REJECTS SHOWS ARE A FUNDRAISER FOR CHAIN THEATRE
The event is a fundraiser for Chain Theatre, a nonprofit arts organization dedicated to supporting independent film and theatre in New York City.

FRI-MON, 8/1-4: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► sat 11am-6pm:
smorgasburg x suntory present: japan meets brooklyn – matsuri
: smorgasburg (williamsburg).
>>
► sat 3-9pm:
jersey city night market
: city hall ancillary lot. free admission (pay-as-you-go).
>>
► sat 3:30-7pm:
brooklyn art meetup
: maria hernandez park (bushwick).
>>
► sun 12-7pm (rain date: 8/9):
third annual summer blockfest hip-hop festival + community celebration
: 770 jackson street, hoboken.
>>
► sun 1-7pm:
phoenicia flea at strong rope brewery
: red hook.

sponsored
image by Jen Chou
The Chain Theatre is thrilled to announce the
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
. A cinematic celebration of bold voices and original storytelling, this year’s festival features
over 160 films
from around the globe—narratives, documentaries, shorts, web series, and animated works—plus panels, filmmaker events, and an awards ceremony.
Special Events Include:
•
The Usual Rejects: a DEMOLITION MAN fan event
on August 8 & 9 | 7:30 pm
A staged parody event with trivia, prizes, audience participation, and drinking games. From the team behind sold-out spoofs of
Titanic, TMNT
, and
Star Wars
. Tickets include a complimentary drink!
•
Industry Panel with Geoffrey Cantor
on Sunday, August 17 | 2PM
Join
Geoffrey Cantor
(
Daredevil, The Punisher
) for a candid discussion on career longevity and indie film survival. Tickets are Free. Reservations required.
Past guests have included
Oscar-winning writers, Emmy-nominated creators
, and industry legends like
Richard LaGravenese
and
Richard Price
. The 2025 festival continues this legacy of discovery and excellence. Chain Theatre’s past collaborators include
Eric Bogosian, Jesse Eisenberg
, and
John Patrick Shanley
sharing new work with Off-Broadway audiences.
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
AUGUST 7-17
The Chain Theatre
312 W 36 Street, 3rd & 4th Floor (Between 8th and 9th ave)
All screenings are $13 in advance and $15 at the door
MORE INFO AND TICKETS
friday
thru the season:
rooftop cinema club
: take your movie night to new heights at rooftop cinema club, the annual open-air movie series held at the third floor skylawn rooftop of the embassy suites hotel in midtown. catch cult favorites, classics, and newer releases all season long, with provided wireless headphones to help block out the city buzz. soda, beer, wine, cocktails, popcorn, candy, hot dogs, pretzels, nachos, pizza, and more are available for purchase to make it a full night out. this month’s screenings include
american psycho, before sunrise, camp beverly hills, clueless, dirty dancing, do the right thing, friday the 13th, grease, sinners, stand by me, taxi driver, twilight, when harry met sally
, and many more. $12-29 admission (15% off for military, 10% off for students).
>>
thru september:
rooftop movies at yotel times square
: take in a flick on the rooftop terrace of the green room 42 at yotel times square. food and drinks will be available for purchase. this month’s selections include
birds of prey, ferris bueller’s day off, titanic
, and more. $21+.
>>
thru 8/31:
snl
ticket lottery
: want to see
saturday night live
live? the show’s free ticket lottery opens 8/1 and runs through the end of the month for a chance at free tickets. didn’t get lucky? you can still try for standby tickets starting at 10am the thursday before each taping.
>>
thru sun (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this weekend: baand together dance festival (thru sat), national book foundation panel: celebrating 20 years of literary debuts (fri 5pm), nelly swing (fri 6:30pm), dj bembona (fri 10pm), paris to patagonia: karen kamensek conducts bizet’s
symphony in c
(fri + sat 7:30pm), globalfest (sat 4:30-11:30pm), and more.
>>
thru sun (various times):
summerstage
: summerstage presents a series of free outdoor shows this weekend: doug e. fresh + funk flex hip-hop appreciation park jam and bbq featuring doug e. fresh, taana gardner, strafe, grandmaster melle mel + scorpio, and more at crotona park in the bronx (fri 6-9pm), ghanafest-ny presents: kidi, skrewfaze, and dj chvmeleon at crotona park in the bronx (sat 6-9pm), and taiwanese waves presents: enno cheng, abao + nanguaq girls, bulareyaung dance company, and chinatown records at rumsey playfield in central park (sun 6-10pm).
>>
sponsored
: fri + sat:
flop house comedy club
: nyc’s friendliest indie comedy club—with great comics, a cozy atmosphere, and no drink minimums—has some incredible lineups this weekend! save 33% with promo code ‘skint’ for any of these shows: at 362 grand street in williamsburg – ashley gavin, anthony moore, and sean millea (friday 8pm + 9:30pm); colleen genevieve, brittany carney, and caitlin peluffo (saturday 8pm + 9:30pm); at 83 1st ave in the east village – ashley gavin, usama siddiquee, david drake, shaunak godkhindi, and mia wilson (saturday 8:30pm + 10pm). food, snacks, and drinks will be available for purchase.
>>
fri + sat (fri 6-9pm, sat 12-4pm):
open worlds at momi
: as part of ‘open worlds’ free community programs, museum of the moving image (astoria) hosts a bollywood disco talk and party with dj rekha, filmmaker saleem nasir gondal, and critic and
film comment
editor devika girish (friday), and an afternoon with cinematographer mia cioffi henry (
sorry, baby
) and film programmer shayana filmore on the art and science of cinematography and film lighting, with a focus on the impact of black innovations in the field (saturday).
>>
fri + sat (various dates thru 8/16):
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running, free, outdoor performing arts festival returns to prospect park’s lena horne bandshell for two months. this weekend: mireya ramos and the poor choices, morley, and talibah safiya (fri 6pm doors); gogol bordello, puzzled panther, and pons (sat 6pm doors).
>>
fri various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
clueless
at hunter’s point south park (lic)
>>
moana 2
at bethune park (jersey city)
>>
moana 2
at twenty-four sycamores park (lenox hill)
>>
purple rain
at transmitter park (greenpoint)
>>
wicked
at southpoint park (roosevelt island)
>>
fri 10am-9pm (monthly):
first friday at poster house
: enjoy free admission, extended hours, and special programming at poster house’s first friday. today’s programming includes a subway-inspired printmaking workshop, a screening of
dr. strangelove, or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
, a neighborhood advertising walk + critique, and more. note: some activities require separate, paid tickets to participate. poster house (flatiron).
>>
fri 4-10pm (fridays thru 8/22):
warm up 2025
: kick off your summer weekends at moma ps1’s warm up, the popular outdoor music series spotlighting underground and emerging electronic talent from around the world. dance in ps1’s open-air courtyard, featuring yto barrada’s installation
le grand soir
, and explore the museum’s exhibitions until late. tonight: eric d. clark, ok williams, dj spanish fly, and masaaki. moma ps1 (lic) $25+ general, $20+ students.
>>
fri 6pm:
first novel friday
: join the center for fiction for an evening celebrating a selection of notable debut novels. the night begins with a happy hour reception in the lounge (cash bar), followed by author readings, discussion, and signings in the auditorium. tonight’s novels feature characters searching for a sense of self and place in the world while being pulled in many directions, with authors naomi xu elegant (
gingko season
), benedict nguyễn (
hot girls with balls
), stephanie wambugu (
lonely crowds
), and moderator torrey peters (
detransition, baby
). the center for fiction (fort greene), $5+ admission.
>>
fri 6:30pm (monthly):
lower east stories
: p+t knitwear bookstore + café (les) presents a storytelling salon where each month brings a fresh theme and fresh tales. tonight’s theme: ‘third chances.’ hosted by matt storrs. $10 admission ($5 of the ticket price can be applied towards any item in the bookstore or café).
>>
fri 7pm (monthly):
immigrant jam comedy
: german-born, nyc-raised comedian and actor lucie pohl (
overwatch
) celebrates all things cross-cultural, international, and delightfully different at the immigrant jam stand-up show, featuring immigrant and first generation comedians. tonight’s lineup reps china, colombia, germany, jamaica, pakistan, and romania with performers eva evans (netflix presents), fareeha khan (comedy central), felipe torres medina (
colbert
), peng dang (tiktok), and more. a portion of the proceeds will go to new women new yorkers. caveat (les), $18.76 with promo code ‘jamily’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
fri 7pm:
bryant park picnic performances
: bryant park’s annual summer performance series is back with 25 evenings of free live music, theater, and dance in the heart of midtown. bring your own picnic or purchase food and drinks from on-site vendors. blankets and bistro chairs are provided for use. next up: carnegie hall’s citywide series presents pianist and composer orrin evans and the grammy award–nominated captain black big band.
>>
fri 7:30pm + 9pm (ongoing):
free fridays at magnet theater
: magnet theater (chelsea) introduces free fridays, where you can catch two of their flagship improv shows — premiere: the improvised musical and the friday night show — for exactly zero dollars on the first friday of every month. first come, first served.
>>
fri 8:30pm:
bitches brew comedy show
: this women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of halyards (gowanus). tonight’s performers include sabeen sadiq, alex pavone, gracie canaan, naomi karavani, and moe yacub. free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show).
>>
fri 9pm:
the drunk texts:
harry the first, or the knave who hath liv’d
: random access theatre celebrates harry potter’s birthday with
harry the first, or the knave who hath liv’d
, a shakespearean retelling of
harry potter and the sorcerer’s stone
that combines drinking games, improvisation, and audience participation. the rat nyc (dumbo), $10-12.
>>
fri 9:30pm:
awkward sex… and the city storytelling show
: from cocaine-infused one-night stands to ibs flare-ups during cunnilingus, comedian natalie wall and guest storytellers share the humor of awkward dating and sexual encounters. caveat (les), $12 adv, $15 door.
>>
saturday
sat thru 8/10:
catvideofest 2025
: catvideofest returns to the big screen with cool kitty clips of all kinds, from fresh submissions to sourced animations, music videos, and iconic internet gems. bonus: a portion of ticket proceeds from every show will go to local animal shelters and/or animal welfare organizations. alamo drafthouse manhattan (8/2-6), ifc center (8/2-3), museum of the moving image (8/2-10), nitehawk cinema williamsburg and prospect park (8/2-10), and syndicated (8/2-6). various prices.
>>
sat + sun 6pm:
shakespeare in the garden
: stag + lion theatre co. presents their take on shakepeare’s
as you like it
in west side community garden’s floral setting. free admission.
>>
sat + sun (7pm):
blank page theatre co’s 2025 summer new works festival
: discover new stories based on today’s social climate at blank page theatre co’s 2025 summer new works festival. now in its fourth year, the festival presents four original plays centered around year’s theme of diversity, equity, and inclusion, chosen from more than 150 submissions. the tank (midtown), $23.
>>
sat various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
i am not your negro
at james baldwin lawn in st. nicholas park (harlem)
>>
the day the earth blew up: a looney tunes movie
at carroll park (carroll gardens)
>>
sat 7am-3pm (saturdays thru 8/23):
nyc summer streets festival
:the annual summer streets festival turns nyc into a car-free playground, with over 400 blocks open for walking, running, biking, and exploring across five saturdays. enjoy free performances, fitness classes, kids’ activities, and more. today: manhattan (from the brooklyn bridge to broadway and dykman street).
>>
sat 1pm:
wnyc’s public song project concert
: history remixed. wnyc’s public song project invited musicians and hobbyists alike to submit song covers and musical adaptations of books, poetry, films, and more, showcasing the creative potential of the public domain. join host simon close for an outdoor concert on the brooklyn public library’s central library plaza (prospect heights) featuring winning submissions, plus performances by winners of the anthem to us project, which asked new yorkers to reimagine a new national anthem. free admission.
>>
sat 1:30pm:
how embarrassing is jesus?
a queer psychedelic comedy
: award-winning and -losing writer lauren duca (of
teen vogue
, tucker carlson, buzzfeed, and
how to start a revolution
fame) tries to figure out if jesus can be saved in this comedy directed by obie-award-winning trans performance artist becca blackwell. caveat (les), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
sat 5pm doors (thru 8/17):
rise up nyc
: the rise up nyc summer concert series returns with 10 free outdoor concerts across the five boroughs. tonight’s manhattan edition features johnny gill and big daddy kane outside of the apollo theatre in harlem.
>>
sat 5-9:30pm (monthly):
first saturdays at brooklyn museum: ‘en fuego’
: brooklyn museum hosts a full evening of live music, talks, film screenings, hands-on art, tours, and more. tonight’s ‘en fuego’ edition celebrates artists from the caribbean diaspora in the lead-up to the west indian day parade. free admission includes museum general admission (rsvp required).
>>
sat 6-10pm (rain date 9/20):
silent disco
: tune in to your vibe at the monthly silent disco event at riverside park’s pier i, with three djs spinning tunes of different genres straight into your wireless headphones (provided). free admission (a credit or debit card is needed for the check-in process to use the required headphones).
>>
sat 7pm (monthly):
tom d’s big new york show
: comedian and licensed nyc tour guide tom delgado takes you through different aspects of nyc each month, with history, comedy, trivia with prizes, and special guests. tonight’s show features shane torres (
conan
), tom mccaffrey (comedy central), and sheila foster (professor at columbia law school and author of
co-cities
). save $5 with promo code ‘tomdnyc’
>>
sat 7pm (monthly):
flopsauce comedy show
: the monthly stand-up showcase where comedians dish out their latest failures (flops) and successes (sauces) returns for more servings. featuring fareeha khan, christine fiala, delia kemph, guy awn, angela sawyer, and lukas arnold. hosted by kayla kirk and emily baker. secret pour (bushwick / bed-stuy), free admission.
>>
sat 7pm:
a.i. vs human comedy roast battle
: a human rapper takes on machine-learning a.i. in a comedy/rap roast battle of the times. hosted by harmon leon. the players theatre (greenwich village), a limited number of $10 tickets are available with promo code ‘theskint’ (reg. $42).
>>
sat 7:30pm (monthly):
feel the news with marcela onyango
: in this monthly variety comedy show, ‘radical lefty’ comedian marcela onyango breaks down the latest headlines—helping you decide whether to be mad, glad, or just deeply confused. each show supports direct action efforts, raising funds for mutual aid projects. tonight’s guests include katrina davis, tawanda gona, amanda gordon, mo reyes, nat towsen, and sophia v. friends and lovers (crown heights), $10.
>>
sunday
sun 2-6pm (sundays thru 8/24):
union pool’s 13th annual summer thunder concert series
: williamsburg’s union pool hosts free afternoon concerts every sunday thru summer. today: ted leo and aitis band. note: according to union pool’s instagram, admission is first come first served and rsvp is not required for entry.
>>
sun 5pm (weather permitting):
free outdoor movie
: carnegie hall presents: bizet’s
carmen
at bryant park (midtown).
>>
sun 5pm:
rejected shorts
: writer and comedian michelle cohn (vulture, mcsweeney’s) hosts a show where nyc writers and comedians join together to celebrate scorned satire, bad headlines, jokes that don’t land, and other art smacked with the cruel hand of rejection. featuring river clegg (
the new yorker
), liz hynes (
john oliver
), taylor kay phillips (mcsweeney’s), marcela onyango (feel the news), pat cassels (
samantha bee
), leah abrams (limousine reading series), and michelle chan bennett (bada swing!). caveat (les), $15.67 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $24-25)
>>
sun 7pm:
know it alls
: is ghosting socially acceptable? does nature or nurture win in the end? watch comedians with strong convictions battle it out over debate topics like these and more at the know it alls show. hosted by catherine lindsay. eris mainstage (williamsburg), $12 adv, $17 day of.
>>
monday
mon thru 8/24:
the tank’s limefest
: the tank’s annual limefest returns with 22 new, ‘zesty’ productions by emerging theater artists and creative teams who identify as women, non-binary, or gender nonconforming. the tank (midtown), $23+.
>>
mon various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
blades of glory
at bryant park (midtown)
>>
damn yankees
at the hudson (inwood)
>>
grease
at astoria park (queens)
>>
mon 4:30pm, 7pm (monthly):
angelika ‘classics’ screening series
: village east by angelika’s ‘classics’ screening series celebrates iconic films. next up: richard linklater’s
dazed and confused
(1993), starring wiley wiggins, jason london, matthew mcconaughey, parker posey, and ben affleck. $19.
>>
mon 6:30pm (mondays thru 8/11):
broadway by the boardwalk
: enjoy show tunes with a view at broadway by the boardwalk, an annual summer concert series featuring broadway stars performing at clinton cove in hudson river park. this outdoor event invites guests to bring blankets, stretch out on the grass, and take in an evening of music right by the water. the season continues tonight with zachary noah piser (
redwood
). free admission.
>>
mon 7pm:
david levithan + jens lekman:
songs for other people’s weddings
: writer david levithan (
every day, nick + norah’s infinite playlist
) and singer-songwriter jens lekman celebrate the launch of their new book
songs for other people’s weddings
at strand bookstore (union square) with a discussion and performance. $10 admission, $28 ticket option includes a copy of the book.
>>
mon 7:30pm (monthly):
miss manhattan non-fiction reading series
: elyssa goodman and r.c. gstaad iii’s monthly showcase for nonfiction writers returns for an evening of readings by samantha mann (
dyke delusions
), arianna rebolini (
better: a memoir about wanting to die
), ben seagreen (
rupaul’s drag race
), and holly mitchell (
mare’s nest
). niagara bar (east village), free admission.
>>
mon 8pm:
the moth storyslam
: the popular community-based open mic storytelling competition, where anyone can share a five-minute tale based on the evening’s theme to an attentive audience, returns to the bell house (gowanus). tonight’s theme: ‘childish.’ $19.65.
>>
mon 9pm:
jena friedman: motherf*cker
: comedian and writer jena friedman (
indefensible, the daily show
) works out her new hour about motherhood, grief and this current political moment before she premiers it at the edinburgh fringe. q.e.d. (astoria), $15.
>>
mon 9:30pm:
the ultimate set-up: an improvised dating game
: watch sparks fly or hilariously fizzle at
the ultimate set-up
, an improvised dating game where bold singles and the friends who volunteered them take the stage. hosted by matchmakers dr. romeo smoocherson and dr. darcy tenderfield, this show pairs participants on stage, with the audience and the singles deciding who’s a match. after the show, matched couples get free drinks, while everyone else is invited to mix and mingle the old-fashioned way. caveat (les), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: TUES-THURS, 7/29-8/1: HALF-OFF CHEESECAKE, KATE BUSH PARTY, WAGNER PARK REOPENING, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 7/29-8/1: HALF-OFF CHEESECAKE, KATE BUSH PARTY, WAGNER PARK REOPENING, AND MORE
tuesday
thru 10/29:
wagner park reopening
: after a two-year closure for resiliency improvements, downtown’s wagner park
reopens
to the public. the 3.5-acre waterfront space will host a lineup of free events through october, kicking off with an outdoor performance by taylor mac 7/29 at 7pm.
>>
thru thurs (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: baand together dance festival (thru sat), salsa en tacones (weds 6pm), toño rosario (weds 8pm),
warriors
listening party with lin-manuel miranda and eisa davis (weds 9:30pm), funk + soul dance party with urban bush women (thurs 6:30pm), ammoye (thurs 7:30pm), and more.
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
elf
and
party girl
at domino park (williamsburg)
>>
the devil wears prada
at pier 17 heineken riverdeck
>>
tues 7pm:
letters + sodas: lic reading series
: writer lana schwartz (
build your own romantic comedy
) brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at the greats of craft (lic). featuring meg reid (the onion), just lunning (the hard times), james folta (
esquire
), pooja reddy (kutti gang), brian gresko (
the atlantic
), and shem pennant (say less comedy). $5.
>>
tues 7pm:
nyc magic ensemble
: expect the unexpected as the nyc magic ensemble presents a night of magicians and mentalists at young ethel’s (south slope), featuring performers carl mercurio, sara crasson, and mike kurylo. $10 (a limited number of 2-for-$15 tickets are also available).
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: afro-colombian ensemble rebolú. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm:
rooftop films: new york non-fiction 2025
: the popular rooftop films series, one of the word’s longest-running and largest outdoor showcases for indie film, returns for its 29th season. tonight: jessica earnshaw’s
baby doe
at the old american can factory (gowanus), followed by filmmaker discussion and a reception. $20.
>>
tues 8pm:
live band karaoke at arlene’s grocery
: choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and take the stage with your very own live band (nakatomi5) backing you up at arlene’s grocery (les). $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
sponsored
The number-one song of the land in the summer of 1995 was a meaningful gem from a trio called TLC.
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
will mark that 30th anniversary by giving you double shots of T-Boz, Chilli and Left Eye all night long. Plus DJ Steve will also serve up our usual mix of the best rock, pop, R&B, hip-hop and dance tunes from the 1990s and 2000s!
Unhitch that overall strap, lace up your Docs, tie that flannel around your waist, put on some frosted lip gloss and set your VCR to record Dawson’s Creek and Gilmore Girls — Party Like it’s 1999 is Brooklyn’s best 1990s and 2000s dance party where you’ll shake it to the best pop, rock, hip hop and R&B jams all night long!
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
Saturday, August 9 10:30pm – 3:30 am
Doors: 10:00pm | Show: 10:30pm
Littlefield
635 Sackett Street
Brooklyn, NY 11217
• R to Union Street, then
one block to Sackett Street
• 2, 3, 4, 5, B, D, N, Q to
Atlantic Avenue or Pacific Street. 9 blocks south to Sackett Street
GET TICKETS
wednesday
weds thru 8/5:
silent movie week at moma
: the museum of modern art presents its third annual silent movie week, featuring seven recently restored silent films from 1923-28. the series opens with walter ruttmann’s
berlin: symphony of a city
, presented with live musical accompaniment in the abby aldrich rockefeller sculpture garden (weather permitting). museum of modern art (midtown), $14 general, $12 seniors, $10 students.
>>
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
captain america: brave new world
at rainey park (lic)
>>
dark toons
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
dirty dancing
at resiliencity park (hoboken)
>>
kung fu panda 4
at tompkins square park (east village)
>>
mean girls
at prospect park (prospect park)
>>
the grand budapest hotel
at pier i in riverside park south (uws)
>>
sponsored
:
up
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
weds 12-6pm:
50% off eileen’s special cheesecake
: say cheese(cake)! eileen’s special cheesecake shop in nolita is celebrating its 50th anniversary (and national cheesecake day) with 50% off all individual and 6-inch cheesecakes. while supplies last.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: country singer–songwriter brittney spencer with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (monthly):
not in my backyard! a political comedy roundtable
: a panel of opinionated nyc comedians, journalists, and politicians debate the local issues causing drama in your neighborhood’s facebook group. each show will also include a pop quiz on nyc knowledge. hosted by cody lindquist (
our cartoon president
) and charlie todd (improv everywhere), with panelists anthony atamanuik (
what we do in the shadows
), lindsey boylan (campaign to stop cuomo), and catherine vaughan (abundance new york). ucb (east village), $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
weds 7pm:
artists + beers
: pair cinema with cervezas at ‘artists + beers,’ a semi-monthly screening series highlighting short films, docs, and music videos by local filmmakers. hosted by nancy pop, curran banach, and chip parham. all night skate (bed-stuy), free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
jazz at pier 84
: jazz up your evening with the jazz foundation of america’s free outdoor concerts at hudson river park’s pier 84 (hell’s kitchen). the season continues with pucci amanda jhones.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring sarah tollemache (comedy central), ashton womack (
the daily show
), ashlynn salzano (
that time of the week
), alex dragicevich, and tim smith. hosted by josh johnson, brittany cardwell, and lucas connolly. free admission.
>>
weds 9:30pm (weekly):
friends with caveats
: expect everything from stand-up and character performances to music and even powerpoint presentations at caveat’s weekly comedy show, ‘friends with caveats.’ tonight’s lineup features myq kaplan (comedy central), adam mitrani (
why aren’t you more famous?
), rebecca weiser (reductress), nikolai vanyo (vocabaret), ben miller, jimmy ong, and chesarae. hosted by delia kemph. caveat (les), $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 8/17:
the little shakespeare festival: ‘not your english teacher’s shakespeare’
: frigid new york’s annual little shakespeare festival invites indie theatre companies to put their own spin on the bard’s classics. this year’s 10 productions include a shakespearean parody of
the princess bride
, a telenova-style
hamlet
, and more. under st. marks (east village), $20-25.
>>
thurs thru 8/10:
48th asian american international film festival
: the annual asian american international film festival, presented by asian cinevision, presents 11 days of indie films and programming at asia society, welcome to chinatown hub, regal union square, and online. various prices.
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
a minecraft movie
at tanahey playground (les)
>>
ferris bueller’s day off
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
men in black
at union square park
>>
monsters university
at boyd mcguiness park (jersey city)
>>
the matrix
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor viewn lawn
>>
thurs (various times):
summerstage
: summerstage presents a pair of free outdoor shows tonight: frankie negrón, christian alicea, and funk salsa urban at crotona park in the bronx (5-9pm) and summer dayes 2025 with the yussef dayes experience, fkj, venna, and salin at rumsey playfield in central park (6-10pm).
>>
thurs 12:30pm (season ends today):
broadway in bryant park
: broadway comes to bryant park as stars perform some of their biggest hits at this annual lunchtime performance series. today: ‘disney on broadway’ with
aladdin
,
beauty and the beast
, and
the lion king
). hosted by lite fm’s cubby and christine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm (season ends tonight):
live at the archway: summer music + art in the dumbo archway
: sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the manhattan bridge in dumbo. tonight: psychedelic cumbia group chicha libre and chelsea bonosky. food and drink will be available for purchase. rain or shine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm:
winging it: an open mic night at lofty pigeon books
: share your script, your poem, your music, your jokes, or just your support at this open mic night held at kensington’s lofty pigeon books, hosted by comedian, performer, author, and
new yorker
cartoonist emily flake. light refreshments will be served, and attendees will save 10% on store purchases. free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (season ends tonight):
summer music series at bushwick inlet park
: soak up the sounds and skyline river sunset at the friends of bushwick inlet park’s fifth annual summer music series. tonight: carol sudhalter quintet. 86 kent shoreline esplanade (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 8/14):
sunset salsa
: dance into golden hour at hudson river park’s sunset salsa series, returning to pier 76 (midtown west) for the summer. led by performer and instructor talía castro-pozo, each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson—open to first-timers and seasoned dancers alike—followed by an open dance party with guest djs. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm (monthly):
golden spiral comedy show
: at mindy raf and katie compa’s golden spiral comedy show, stand-up set lengths follow the fibonacci sequence (5, 8, 13, and 21 minutes each). tonight’s show at whiskey cellar nyc (east village) includes guests kendra dawsey, sue funke, jilberto soto, and leighann lord. advance ticket purchase includes a raffle ticket for a free drink. a limited number of tickets are available for $7.18 with promo code ‘skintspiral’ (reg. $10.38+).
>>
thurs 7pm doors (season ends tonight):
river + blues concert series
: settle in for sunset sounds at nelson a. rockefeller park, where the annual river + blues concert series brings global and american folk, roots, and blues artists to the waterfront. bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic (or purchase snacks and drinks on-site), and enjoy the music with hudson river views. tonight: lady blackbird with opener dj blessed. free admission.
>>
thurs 7:30pm (season ends tonight):
astoria park concert series
: central astoria ldc’s annual concert series returns with four nights of live music on the ditmars side lawn at astoria park. tonight: the sky high band (90s/2000s hits). free admission.
>>
thurs 9:30pm:
fightin’ words! a language game show
: three contestants compete in a series of word-based games to win the ultimate prize: a new word of their creation will be added to the people’s lexicon. featuring guest contestants michael cruz cayne, whitley watson, and rachel coster. hosted by jerzy gwiazdowski. $13.61 with promo code ‘skintwords’ (reg. $18.76-20).
>>
thurs 10pm:
happy birthday, kate: a kate bush party
: bush bash! dj bright light bright light’s annual dance party celebrating all things kate bush returns to c’mon everybody (bed-stuy). $12.36.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, chain theatre’s summer one-act festival, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: FRI-MON, 7/25-28: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 7/25-28: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► thru sun:
46th annual thunderbird american indian powwow
: queens county farm museum. $19 admission supports thunderbird american indian dancers scholarship fund and the queens county farm museum education program.
>>
► thru sun:
115th annual st. ann’s feast (fka st. ann italian festival)
: 7th + jefferson streets (hoboken).
>>
► fri 8-11:30pm (+ 8/15):
chinatown night market’s final season
: forsyth plaza.
>>
► sat 11am-5pm:
wax + stacks: brooklyn flea record fair
: new york public library for the performing arts (uws).
>>
►
sponsored

returns to the Brooklyn Navy Yard Waterfront Promenade on
