Title: TUES-THURS, 7/22-24: UPTOWN BOUNCE, THE AUD BALL, DISNEY PAGEANT, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 7/22-24: UPTOWN BOUNCE, THE AUD BALL, DISNEY PAGEANT, AND MORE
tuesday
movies at the united palace with lin-manuel miranda and leslie odom, jr.: reservations are now available
: the movies at the united palace (washington heights) series celebrates the 10-year anniversary of
hamilton
on broadway with a series of films and tv series starring the original cast. next up:
blindspotting
(2021), followed by a discussion with lin-manuel miranda, daveed diggs, and jasmine cephas jones. free tickets to the 7/28 event are now available.
>>
thru thurs (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: ‘folklore and legends’ : jonathon heyward conducts brahms’s first symphony (tues + weds 7:30pm), sekou mcmiller and the palladium mambo band (weds 6pm),
waitress: the musical
in american sign language by deaf broadway (weds 8pm), library silent disco: decades party 1965-2025 with dj bill coleman (weds 8pm), social dance (tango): leonardo suarez-paz: ‘piazzolla100’ (thurs 6:30pm), and more.
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
the great gatsby
at pier 17 heineken riverdeck (lower manhattan)
>>
transformers one
at arlington park (jersey city)
>>
tues 5pm (+ 8/16):
hamilton
celebrates 10 years at hudson yards
: broadway’s
hamilton
celebrates 10 years with a series of free events at hudson yards’ public square + gardens. tonight: past and present cast members—including miguel cervantes, hannah cruz, thayne jasperson, and edred utomi—come together for a behind-the-scenes conversation about their journey with the show, from its early days to its future legacy.
>>
tues 7pm (monthly):
we love a theme: a storytelling show
: a lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at bailey swilley’s monthly storytelling show. tonight’s ‘burned’ theme features calvin cato, adam selbst, wes hazard, and carly ciarrochi. pete’s candy store (williamsburg), free ($5 suggested donation).
>>
tues 7pm:
jazz foundation presents: sunset sounds
: the jazz foundation of america presents a pair of sunset concerts on the hudson. tonight’s finale: axel tosca trio with xiomara laugart. pier i at 70th street, free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: gotham kings, led by two-time grammy-nominated trumpeter alphonso horne. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm (+ 8/5):
naumburg orchestral concerts: 2025 season
: the naumburg orchestral concerts series returns for its 120th season at historic naumburg bandshell in central park. tonight: nosky’s baroque band, conducted by aisslinn nosky, performs works by handel, haydn, and vivaldi. hosted by wqxr’s annie bergen. all concerts will be broadcast live. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm:
cinema smootaphilia
: ‘summer heat’: ensemble erotic (ann courtney on vocals, dave smoota smith on casio and beats, jerome jordan on guitar, and jeremy kay on bass) perform a live, original soundtrack to a compilation of some of the hottest, most original, and captivating sex scenes in cinema history. tv eye (ridgewood), $17.
>>
sponsored
The
Brooklyn Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
returns to the Brooklyn Navy Yard Waterfront Promenade on
Saturday, July 26
with more than 100 styles of beer, wine, and sprits from producers near and far!  It’s the perfect chance to hang with friends and chat with brewers, sommeliers, and master distillers about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours.
Guests can enjoy unlimited samples for the entire session, along with live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Chavas Empanadas, Mozzarepas, and Taste of Poland.

Session Times:
Session 1: 1pm – 4:30pm
Session 2: 6pm – 9:30pm
Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 77 Waterfront Promenade
141 Flushing Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205
21+ Only
wednesday
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
a minecraft movie
at walter francis white playground (east harlem)
>>
clueless
at resiliencity park (hoboken)
>>
dirty dancing
at pier i in riverside park south (uws)
>>
guardians of the galaxy vol. 3
at sunset park (brooklyn)
>>
hairspray
at elizabeth street garden (nolita)
>>
sponsored
:
rhinestone
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
trapped: mind-altering shorts 2025
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
weds 6pm:
carnegie hall citywide: catalyst quartet
: carnegie hall presents a series of free concerts across nyc. tonight: grammy award–winning catalyst quartet comes to madison square park’s oval lawn for an outdoor concert featuring works by pete seeger, joni mitchell, joseph kosma, will holt, aftab darvishi, and astor piazzolla. free admission.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: singer-songwriter alex sampson with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm:
peer revue
: ted talks with a twist. peer revue makes its debut with real experts giving real talks on big ideas—like quarks or the fall of rome—while comedians wing it through slides they’ve never seen before. hosted by ben lillie, with emily costa (
facts machine
), paula croxson (
the story collider
), andrea-jones rooy (
the data science spectacular
), brian morabito (
dropout
), brielle demirjian (
the daily show
), mick szal (
and scene
), and more. caveat (les), $13.61 with promo code ‘skintrevue’ (reg. $18.76-20)
>>
weds 7pm (series ends tonight):
summer sounds! at carl schurz park
: steel impressions caribbean band returns for this year’s summer sounds! concert series, presented by the carl schurz park conservancy at the elevated john finley walk (yorkville). free admission.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
taste of science: ticks
: the fordam tick index is currently at 8/10. but how much do you really know about these tiny monsters? taste of science presents a talk at ryan’s daughter pub (ues) with two experts on ticks and the diseases they carry, including tips for protecting yourself in the outdoors this summer. free admission (donations welcome).
>>
weds 7:30pm:
well well well! comedy
: chuckles for charity. co-hosts griffin leeds and nora jefferies present an all-lgbtq+ comedy show at the rosemont (williamsburg), with proceeds benefiting the ali forney center. featuring jared goldstein, jilberto soto, aurea young, and julia wendt. $9 suggested donation.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
we have fun: a stand-up show
: hosts zach sims and dan wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to young ethel’s (south slope), with stand-up by nat towsen (
fallon
), katie blunt (milk and cookies comedy), jim search (
upstate understandings
, and joe briggs (
the boys are back
). free admission.
>>
weds 8pm (monthly):
ditmas lit
: a diverse range of fiction writers, storytellers, poets, and essayists share their work at the ditmas lit series, returning to the urbane arts club (ditmas park) with belle ling (
a seed and a plant
), anthony thomas lombardi (
murmurations
), heather mccalden (
the observable universe
), and ruben reyes, jr. (
there is a rio grande in heaven
). free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
the moth storytelling show: community showcase
: the moth community program, which brings storytelling to nonprofits and cultural organizations, presents an evening of true stories told by six storytellers at roulette intermedium (boerum hill). $17.50.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring andy haynes (comedy central), jared goldstein (
after midnight
), sam evans (
cracked
), usama siddiquee (showtime), and raj suresh (siriusxm). hosted by josh johnson, lucas connolly, and brittany cardwell. free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
the aud ball: justice for all
: drag performer suddenly audrey’s aud ball celebrates the dc universe and gotham glamour with a high-powered night of drag performances, dancing, cosplay, and a queer vendor market at 3 dollar bill (east williamsburg). $14.48 with promo code ‘punkrocker’ (reg. $19.48 adv, $34.95 day of).
>>
weds 8:30pm:
spell checc: a spelling bee gameshow
: watch comedians butcher tough words from all sorts of categories while racking up (or losing) points for making each other—and the announcer—crack up at this spelling bee packed with roasts, lifelines, and comedic chaos. the last speller standing wins bragging rights and a thrifted trophy from a random sporting event. featuring chloe troast, kyle gordon, simmi singh, and dan toomey with hosts jorge oyola and michael sanky. ucb (east village), $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 8/17 (thursdays-sundays at 6:30pm):
hudson classical theater company:
the lady from the sea
: hudson classical theater company celebrates its 22nd summer season with intimate, outdoor productions henrick ibsen’s
the lady from the sea
at the soldiers’ and sailors’ monument in riverside park (uws). pay-what-you-can admission (donations will be accepted following the show).
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
anchorman: the legend of ron burgundy
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
moana 2
at irving square park (bushwick)
>>
sonic the hedgehog 3
at the unisphere in flushing meadows corona park (queens)
>>
the goonies
at fosun plaza at 28 liberty street (lower manhattan)
>>
the muppets take manhattan
at union square park
>>
the wild robot
at bayside park (jersey city)
>>
waitress
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor view lawn (brooklyn bridge park)
>>
wicked
at vincent f. albano jr. playground (kips bay)
>>
thurs 12:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
broadway in bryant park
: broadway comes to bryant park as stars perform some of their biggest hits at this annual lunchtime performance series. today:
hadestown
,
hamilton
,
mamma mia!
,
moulin rouge! the musical
,
six
, and
the outsiders
with a pre-show by the amda college of the performing arts. hosted by lite fm’s rich kaminski. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
live at the archway: summer music + art in the dumbo archway
: sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the manhattan bridge in dumbo. tonight: Philly-based singer-songwriter sug daniels and jenn macksoud. food and drink will be available for purchase. rain or shine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6-9pm:
12th annual uptown bounce
: two museums, one block party—
el museo del barrio
and the
museum of the city of new york
team up once again for the annual uptown bounce. expect djs, dancing, free museum admission, and more, with unique programming at each spot. and since they’re right across the street, feel free to bounce between both all evening long.
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
summer music series at bushwick inlet park
: soak up the sounds and skyline river sunset at the friends of bushwick inlet park’s fifth annual summer music series. tonight: george gray jazz coalition. 86 kent shoreline esplanade (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 8/14):
sunset salsa
: dance into golden hour at hudson river park’s sunset salsa series, returning to pier 76 (midtown west) for the summer. led by performer and instructor talía castro-pozo, each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson—open to first-timers and seasoned dancers alike—followed by an open dance party with guest djs. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm:
top shelf stories
: julia whitehouse serves up an evening of carefully crafted storytelling at ucb (east village). tonight’s show features guests pavar snipe, natasha vaynblat, sharon spell, and nat townsen, plus one open mic slot reserved for an audience member. hosted by julia whitehouse. $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
thurs 7pm doors (thursdays thru 7/31):
river + blues concert series
: settle in for sunset sounds at nelson a. rockefeller park, where the annual river + blues concert series brings global and american folk, roots, and blues artists to the waterfront. bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic (or purchase snacks and drinks on-site), and enjoy the music with hudson river views. tonight: afro latin jazz orchestra and guests led by arturo o’farrill, with opener dj reagonomics. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm doors:
f*bomb presents: hole tribute
: following up last month’s nirvana tribute concert, the f*bomb rock + roll party gets grungy again with a tribute to hole. the bowery electric (east village), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
thurs 7pm doors, 8pm show:
divaland presents: disney channel pageant
: eight drag contestants go head-to-head in three nostalgia-fueled categories inspired by the disney channel shows you couldn’t get enough of. judged by
wizards of waverly place
alum dan benson and
rupaul’s drag race
’s robin fierce, and hosted by jessica rose and frida cox. 3 dollar bill (east williamsburg), $19.48+.
>>
thurs 7:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
astoria park concert series
: central astoria ldc’s annual concert series returns with four nights of live music on the ditmars side lawn at astoria park. tonight: cc + the boys (country hits). free admission.
>>
thurs 8pm doors:
landline comedy at wild east brewing co.
: landline comedy serves up pints of hoppy humor straight from the barrel cellar at wild east brewing co. (gowanus). tonight’s lineup includes caitlin peluffo (
fallon
), toby mcmullen (
dynamite rocketship
), vicki ferentinos (bravo), shane o’connor (the onion), andre medrano (don’t tell comedy), and marecella denby. hosted by andre medrano. bonus: rsvp for a chance to win a free drink. free admission.
>>
thurs 9pm:
a night like this: the cure music video party
: join dj chase coppins and the cure documentarian arusha for a night of projected music videos and other specially-curated visuals accompanying the songs of the cure and their influences, contemporaries, and successors. bar freda (ridgewood), free admission.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 80+ ongoing events and attractions
: friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, chain theatre’s summer one-act festival, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: FRI-MON, 7/18-21: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 7/18-21: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► fri 6-8pm:
art gurl’s third birthday celebration pop-up
: mccarren parkhouse (williamsburg), $5 admission.
>>

: fort greene location.

free gelato

sponsored
The
Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
comes to the renowned
Queens Botanical Garden
on
Saturday, July 19
, pouring more than 100 styles of beer, wine, and sprits from producers near and far!  It’s a perfect chance to view the beautiful summer canna lilies, lantanas, and orchids, hang with friends, discover new favorites, and chat with brewers, sommeliers, and master distillers about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours.
Guests can enjoy unlimited samples all afternoon, plus live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Lobster Cart, Mozzarepas, and Taste of Poland.
Special offer for the skint readers
:
Save 40% on advance tickets with promo code SKINT
GET TICKETS NOW!
Queens Botanical Garden Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
Saturday, July 19
1PM-4:30pm
Queens Botanical Garden
43-50 Main Street Flushing, NY 11355
21+ Only
friday
sponsored
: thru 8/10:
★★★★★ ‘rocked the rafters with bright laughter and gasps of pleasure!’ –
ithaca times
: twilight theatre co. in association with kitchen theatre company presents brian dykstra’s
polishing shakespeare
at 59e59 theaters. a dot-com billionaire pays an esteemed american theatre company to translate shakespeare into english (wait. what?). a sly comedy inspired by an unbelievably true story. to sell out or not to sell out—is that the question? use code skint to snag $19 tickets* (reg. $44)!
>>
thru 7/31:
kurosawa in 4k
: film forum (south village) presents a nine-film festival featuring 4k restorations of some of akira kurosawa’s most influential titles, spanning genres from samurai epic to gritty noir:
high and low, ikiru, rashomon, seven samurai, sanjuro, stray dog, the hidden fortress, throne of blood
, and
yojimbo
. $17.
>>
thru 7/31:
‘nyc 2000s’
: take a look back at the big apple through the aughts at bam’s ‘nyc 2000s’ screening series:
25th hour, brother to brother, man push cart, pieces of april, the devil wears prada, the royal tenenbaums, vanilla sky
, and more. bam rose cinemas (fort greene), $17 general, $12 seniors.
>>
thru sun:
sponsored
:
get insider access to the city’s best secrets this weekend with new york adventure club!
go behind-the-scenes at saint thomas church with an exclusive bell tower climb; explore the gilded age mansions and memorials of riverside drive; go inside the little red lighthouse underneath the george washington bridge; uncover the secret history of new york penn station and moynihan train hall; explore the seaside village of city island; and much more this weekend and beyond with new york adventure club!
>>
thru sun (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. next up: brazil week—a week of concerts and cultural programs featuring latin grammy nominee melly, art-pop diva anelis assumpção, soul-samba singer liniker, and more.
>>
fri various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
guardians of the galaxy vol. 3
at southpoint park (roosevelt island)
>>
mufasa: the lion king
at kaiser park baseball field (coney island)
>>
top gun: maverick
at transmitter park (greenpoint)
>>
vivo
at hamilton fish park (les)
>>
fri 4-10pm (fridays thru 8/22):
warm up 2025
: kick off your summer weekends at moma ps1’s warm up, the popular outdoor music series spotlighting underground and emerging electronic talent from around the world. dance in ps1’s open-air courtyard, featuring yto barrada’s installation
le grand soir
, and explore the museum’s exhibitions until late. tonight: mikeq, dj empress, alex zhang hungtai, tashi dorji, and lydo. moma ps1 (lic) $25+ general, $20+ students.
>>
fri 7pm (monthly):
kweendom
: come out for the kweendom lgbtq+ comedy and storytelling show, featuring performances by carolyn bergier, micah eames, riylan mills, eddie estrada, and marcos montana. pete’s candy store (williamsburg), free admission (donations are welcome and will benefit the here to pee tour).
>>
fri 7pm:
bryant park picnic performances: new york guitar festival presents
: bryant park’s annual summer performance series is back with 25 evenings of free live music, theater, and dance in the heart of midtown. bring your own picnic or purchase food and drinks from on-site vendors. blankets and bistro chairs are provided for use. next up: carnegie hall’s citywide series presents award-winning salsa dura band la excelencia.
>>
fri 8pm:
laugh it off
: bring your problems to the laugh it off show, where audience members submit their everyday problems and comedians try their best to ‘fix’ them. boyb. melrose podcasts (east village), $16.
>>
fri 8:30pm:
bitches brew comedy show
: this women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of halyards (gowanus). tonight’s performers include jonathan van halem (
fallon
), rojo perez (comedy central), mustafa mussa (don’t tell comedy), allie lawrence (off menu comedy), and gabbie watts (siriusxm). free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show).
>>
fri 9pm:
niche night party: come out and play! 90s + early 2000s alt night
: dance the night away to grunge, pop-punk, 90’s, and early 2000’s alternative, with a little bit of pop sprinkled in. revision lounge (alphabet city), free admission.
>>
saturday
sat thru 8/24 (weekends 1-6pm):
brooklyn waterfront artists coalition’s summer exhibitions
: bwac’s seasonal art show fills its 25,000 square foot gallery on the brooklyn waterfront with three new exhibitions: ‘elements of movement’ member show, ‘brooklyn x pittsburgh: the industry of art’ juried exhibition, and ‘amped: the art of rock + roll.’ opening reception 7/19 1-6 pm. bwac gallery (red hook), free admission (donations welcome).
>>
sat thru 8/17:
rise up nyc
: the rise up nyc summer concert series returns with 10 free outdoor concerts across the five boroughs. this weekend’s brooklyn edition includes beenie man and patrice roberts (sat), fabolous, lloyd, honey bxby, jon b, and jennaske (sun), and hezekiah walker, donnie mcclurkin, john p. kee, and erica campbell (mon) at wingate park in prospect-lefferts gardens.
>>
sat + sun (sat 6-10pm, sun 7-10pm):
dj rekha + the roots at flushing meadows corona park
: summerstage presents a pair of free outdoor shows at flushing meadows corona park (queens): dj rekha’s basement bhangra beyond (sat) and the roots with dj scratch (sun).
>>
sat various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
toy story
at bella abzug park (hell’s kitchen)
>>
wicked
at shore park and parkway (bay ridge)
>>
sat 2:45-7pm:
free show brain concert
: show brain returns to maria hernandez park (bushwick) for a free outdoor concert featuring a place to bury strangers, pop music fever dream, venus twins, pons, and dog date.
>>
sat 3pm doors (various dates thru 8/16):
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running free outdoor performing arts festival heads to brower park in crown heights for an evening of film, hip-hop, and reggae, with live performances by johnny osbourne, smif-n-wessun, chip-fu, and bush babees, plus dj sets by ayanna heaven, gabsoul, and dj gringo. the night wraps up with a screening of
bam bam: the sister nancy story
introduced by director alison duke.
>>
sat 6:30pm:
scream scene presents:
child’s play
: find your friend to the end at scream scene’s screening of
child’s play
(1988) at pine box rock shop (bushwick). free admission.
>>
sat 7:30pm:
ready reroll: dungeons and dragons live theater show – ‘break into cyborg prison’ edition
: test your dice-rolling skills at a live-action dungeons and dragons theater show, where audience members can help determine the fate of the actors and comedians improvising their way through the saga. chain theatre (midtown west), $10 adv, $12 door.
>>
sat 9pm:
the legend of you! the personalized improvised adventure
: musical improv meets fantasy adventure meets your latest therapy session in ‘the legend of you: the personalized improvised adventure.’ each performance kicks off with an everyday problem shared by an audience member, which the cast transforms into an epic quest packed with bespoke monsters, magical treasures, and plenty of singing. the rat nyc (dumbo), $15 with promo code ‘washedup’ (reg. $30).
>>
sunday
sun 2pm (+ 8/7, 8/14, 8/28):
the queens jazz trail concert series
: inspired by the queens jazz trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, the annual the queens jazz trail concert series presents seven free jazz concerts in queens parks. tonight: alí bello + the charanga syndicate at the unisphere in flushing meadows corona park (queens).
>>
sun 2-6pm (sundays thru 8/24):
union pool’s 13th annual summer thunder concert series
: williamsburg’s union pool hosts free afternoon concerts every sunday thru summer. today: hannah cohen, evan wright, and dj sara abruna. note: according to union pool’s instagram, admission is first come first served and rsvp is not required for entry.
>>
sun 3pm:
resounding silents: live-scored surrealist silent shorts
: the resounding silents film series presents a screening of surrealist short films from the 1920s-40s, accompanied by an original, live score performed by singer-songwriter ally brown, michael lucarelli, and anthime miller. the living gallery (bushwick), $15 suggested.
>>
sun 5pm (+ 8/17, 8/31, 9/14, 9/28):
poetry at elizabeth street garden
: poets muse on a chosen theme at this outdoor reading series at elizabeth street garden (nolita), where anyone can submit work in advance for a chance to read. today’s theme: ‘current.’ presented by mcnally jackson bookstore with hosts yvonne brooks and joseph reiver. free admission.
>>
sun 7pm (monthly):
new tricks
: good tales don’t age at this storytelling show where all of the performers are over 40. hosted by adrianne frost (the moth storyslam champion) with stories by tracey starin, marc abbot, kambri crews, rita rigano, and ronna levy. tonight’s theme: ‘boom!’ q.e.d. (astoria), $12.
>>
sun 7pm (sundays thru 7/27):
summer on the hudson: amplified sundays
: wind down the weekend with amplified sundays, a golden hour outdoor live music series at pier i in riverside park south (uws). tonight: slavic soul party. free admission.
>>
sun 7:30pm:
character night
: discover new, unusual, and funny characters, impressions, and bits created by a lineup of imaginative performers. hosted by jon monje, paul ton, and sonia nam. magnet theater (chelsea), $10.
>>
sun 7:30pm (monthly):
good god comedy show
: audience members can anonymously share their craziest, cringiest secrets for the hosts to read aloud at this stand-up comedy variety show. tonight’s lineup: joyelle johnson, olivia stadler, jared goldstein, josh nasser, and sara hennessey. hosted by caitlin cook and brittany carney. union hall (park slope), $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
sun 8pm (monthly)
disasterpiece movie night:
andy the talking hedgehog
: from the weird to the wondrous, disasterpiece unearths bad movies for a watch party complete with drinking games, trivia, pizza, and more. tonight: fantasy adventure
andy the talking hedgehog
(2018). wonderville (bushwick), free admission.
>>
sun 9pm (monthly):
you are not alone: an uplifting show about depression
: improvisers and artists that battle depression and mental illness in their day-to-day lives create scenes inspired by personal experiences, showing how laughter can be the best medicine. hosted by aaron gold and michael serpe. magnet theater (chelsea), $10.
>>
monday
mon thru 8/17:
summer restaurant week
: 600 restaurants across nyc serve up special two-course prix-fixe lunches and three-course dinners for $30, $45, or $60.
>>
mon thru 7/27:
trashfest
, and
darkfest
at the tank
: the tank (garment district) presents a pair of eco-forward theatrical series:
trashfest
, which minimizes waste and uses repurposed materials, and
darkfest
, which experiments with alternative lighting sources like candles and flashlights. various prices.
>>
mon various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
ghost
at bryant park (midtown)
>>
ghost world
at pacific park (prospect heights)
>>
la vita è bella (life is beautfiul)
at the hudson (inwood)
>>
mon 4pm, 7pm:
classics in black + white:
dark passage
:
village east
and
cinema 123
by angelika host a series of classic black + white screenings, continuing tonight with delmer daves’
dark passage
(1947), starring humphrey bogart, lauren bacall, and agnes moorehead. $19.
mon 6:30pm (mondays thru 8/11):
broadway by the boardwalk
: enjoy show tunes with a view at broadway by the boardwalk, an annual summer concert series featuring broadway stars performing at clinton cove in hudson river park. this outdoor event invites guests to bring blankets, stretch out on the grass, and take in an evening of music right by the water. the season continues tonight with tony and grammy winner john lloyd young (
jersey boys
). free admission.
>>
mon 7pm (monthly):
and scene
: anything could happen when actors and improvisors share the stage at ‘and scene,’ where the actors know their lines ahead of time and the improvisers make up their parts with no prior knowledge of the scenes. featuring mick szal, quincy dunn-baker, ben frankhauser, connor ratliff, ify nwadiwe, alex dickson, and more. $18.76 with promo code ‘brick’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
mon 7:30pm:
dirty little secrets improv show
: see your secrets turned into comedy gold at the dirty little secrets show, where your anonymously-submitted confessions serve as inspiration for improv performers. the wara theatre (east village), $14.64 with promo code ‘skintsecrets’ (reg. $23.18).
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 80+ ongoing events and attractions
: friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, our lady of mount carmel feast in williamsburg, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: YOU’RE INVITED TO SCRAPPY READING SERIES (SPONSORED)

Content:
YOU’RE INVITED TO SCRAPPY READING SERIES (SPONSORED)
Five emerging and established writers will answer this question at this month’s edition of the
Scrappy Reading Series
, supported by the Red Hook Branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. Join us at
Compère Collective
as these writers share how they interpret “scrappy,” and how they embody this in their writing lives, personal lives, love lives, and any other type of life they are living. This month’s lineup includes:
Sienna Liu, Emily J. Smith, Brian Gresko, Sarah Kasbeer, and g.m. palmer
.
Also enjoy the exhibit by local artist, Lisett Clark-Dziedzic,
Openness
, which brings together a deeply personal and political narrative through works made from recycled materials, fabric collages, and photography. Rooted in the duality of two homes — New York and Chile — the exhibition weaves together themes of sustainability, migration, and identity.
Inspired by the master’s series course, “Scrappy: How To Build an Alternative Literary Life” (offered by
Off Assignment
and led by author
Chloé Caldwell
), Brooklyn writer
Farah Faye
began this series to bring together published and unpublished writers to explore what it means to be scrappy.
Admission is free, scrappiness required. Drinks and snacks will be served!
Space is limited –
register here to attend!
Scrappy Reading Series
Compére Collective
351 Van Brunt Street Brooklyn, NY 11231
Scrappy Reading Series is sponsored, in part, by the Greater New York Arts Development Fund of the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs, administered by Brooklyn Arts Council.

A dot-com billionaire pays an esteemed American theatre company to translate Shakespeare into English (Wait. What?). A sly comedy inspired by an unbelievably true story. To sell out or not to sell out—is that the question?
